BR_text.BRsummary: Upgraded pip fails to install packages with enum34
BR_text.BRdescription:
Upgraded  to the v20.1 fails to install GluonTS. Need to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/iterative/dvc/issues/1995>remove enum34</denchmark-link>
  from conda envs.
 To reproduce
 <denchmark-code>python -m pip install --upgrade -q pip
 python -m pip install -q git+https://github.com/awslabs/gluon-ts@master 
 </denchmark-code>
 
 Screenshots or logs
 <denchmark-code>AttributeError: module 'enum' has no attribute 'IntFlag'
 </denchmark-code>
 
 System information
 A description of your system. Please provide:
 
 SageMaker Python SDK version: 1.56.1
 Framework name (eg. PyTorch) or algorithm (eg. KMeans): MXNet but should affect all conda env
 Framework version: 1.6.0
 Python version: py36
 Custom Docker image (Y/N): N
 
 Additional context
 Related to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/aws/sagemaker-python-sdk/issues/1428>#1428</denchmark-link>

comments_0.comment_text: Just to clarify, you're referring to the mxnet_p36 environment in a SageMaker Notebook Instance?

comments_2.comment_text:
looks like it's due to the installation of enum34 <denchmark-link:https://github.com/aws/sagemaker-python-sdk/blob/master/setup.py#L82>here</denchmark-link>
 . Since this library still supports Python 2 (for now), we do need some kind of change that is compatible with Python 2 before blindly removing enum34.
 as a workaround, are you able to manually uninstall enum34 before installing GluonTS?

comments_3.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/laurenyu>@laurenyu</denchmark-link>
  yes I can pip uninstall it in python3.6. Since SageMaker kernels are either p27 or p36 then it'd make sense to remove it as part of v2.0.0, py27 deprecation plan <denchmark-link:https://github.com/aws/sagemaker-python-sdk/issues/1461>#1461</denchmark-link>

comments_4.comment_text:
Glad you at least have a workaround for now.
 re: v2.0.0 - yep, I was thinking the same thing . I've added it to the description of <denchmark-link:https://github.com/aws/sagemaker-python-sdk/issues/1461>#1461</denchmark-link>
 , and will add this issue to the milestone/project board. If I get a chance, I'll still try to see if there's a Python 2-compatible solution, but from the quick Googling I did yesterday, pretty much everything seemed to point to enum34

comments_5.comment_text:
addressed in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/aws/sagemaker-python-sdk/pull/1609>#1609</denchmark-link>
  and slated for the v2.0.0.rc1 release
